title: Leading in Trade Services
description: In 2023, Luxembourg's trade in services accounted for 315.32% of its GDP, the highest globally, showcasing its significant role in the global service market.

title: Top Financial Services Importer
description: Luxembourg imported 45.84% of its services in insurance and financial services in 2023, indicating a strong demand for financial expertise.

title: Exemplary Government Effectiveness
description: In 2023, Luxembourg achieved a perfect score in government effectiveness, ranking at the top percentile globally.

title: High Export-Driven Economy
description: Exports of goods and services made up 212.53% of Luxembourg's GDP in 2023, highlighting its robust export sector.

title: Strong Trade Activity
description: With trade accounting for 394.22% of GDP in 2023, Luxembourg is a major player in international trade.

title: Exceptional Service Sector Productivity
description: In 2023, the value added per worker in Luxembourg's service sector was $196,335, the highest globally.

title: High GDP Per Capita
description: Luxembourg's GDP per capita was $130,491 in 2023, reflecting its high standard of living and economic prosperity.

title: Top Regulatory Quality
description: In 2023, Luxembourg achieved a perfect score in regulatory quality, placing it among the best globally.

title: High Educational Attainment
description: In 2022, 28.16% of Luxembourg's population aged 25+ had at least a Master's degree, indicating a highly educated workforce.

title: High Consumption Per Capita
description: In 2022, Luxembourg's mean consumption per capita was $103.27 per day, reflecting a high standard of living.

title: High GDP Per Person Employed
description: Luxembourg's GDP per person employed was $265,731 in 2023, showcasing its productive workforce.

title: Strong R&D Workforce
description: In 2017, Luxembourg had 3,166 technicians in R&D per million people, indicating a robust focus on innovation.

title: Generous ODA Contribution
description: In 2022, Luxembourg provided 0.37% of its GNI as ODA to the least developed countries, reflecting its commitment to global development.

title: Low Threat to Fish Species
description: In 2018, Luxembourg reported only 1 threatened fish species, indicating a minimal impact on aquatic biodiversity.

title: Minimal Child Mortality Rate
description: As of 2023, Luxembourg has a low probability of 0.2 per 1,000 for children aged 5-9 and 10-14 years dying, showcasing effective healthcare systems.

title: Low Youth Mortality Rate
description: In 2023, the probability of dying among youth aged 20-24 years was 0.9 per 1,000, reflecting strong public health measures.

title: Minimal Prosperity Gap
description: In 2022, Luxembourg had an average shortfall of $0.4 from the prosperity standard of $28/day, indicating a high standard of living.

title: Low Food Insecurity
description: In 2022, only 0.6% of Luxembourg's population experienced severe food insecurity, highlighting effective food distribution systems.

title: Limited Financial Reserves
description: In 2023, Luxembourg's total reserves were equivalent to only 0.07 months of imports, indicating a potential vulnerability in economic stability.
